bio: John Smith is a renowned chef with over 20 years of experience in the culinary arts. He specializes in French cuisine and has worked at some of the top restaurants in the world.

recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, heat oil over medium-high heat. 
2. Add onion and sauté until softened. 
3. Add beef and cook until browned. 
4. Add chopped tomatoes, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala. 
5. Stir and cook for 5-10 minutes. 
6. Add coconut milk and cook for an additional 10 minutes. 
7. Garnish with cilantro and serve hot.

ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions until al dente. 
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently. 
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally, until pink and cooked through. 
4. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet with the shrimp and garlic. Toss to combine. 
5. Add the parsley, salt, and black pepper and toss again. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Beef Stir-Fry
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, cornstarch, and 1/4 cup water. Set aside. 
2. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat. 
3. Add the beef to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently, until browned. 
4. Add the garlic, bell peppers, and onion to the skillet and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender-crisp. 
5. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the beef and vegetables and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes, until the sauce has thickened. 
6. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve over rice.
